text: Psalm 109
A Prayer for Help against Enemies
For the \add music\add* director. A psalm of David.\f + \fr Ps 109 \ft The Hebrew Bible counts the superscription as the first verse of the psalm \f*
O God of my praise, do not keep silent,
for ⸤wicked and deceitful mouths⸥\f + \fr 109:2 \ft Literally “a wicked mouth and a deceitful mouth” \f*
have opened against me.
They speak to me with a lying tongue.
They also surround me with words of hate,
and fight me without cause.
In return for my love they accuse me,
though I \add am in\add* prayer.\f + \fr 109:4 \ft Or perhaps “I \fq have \ft a plea \fq of innocence \ft ” \f*
So they inflicted evil against me in return for good
and hatred in return for my love.
Appoint over him a wicked \add man\add*,
and let an accuser stand at his right \add hand\add*.
When he is judged, let him come out guilty,
and let his prayer\f + \fr 109:7 \ft Or perhaps “plea \fq of innocence \ft ” \f* become as sin.
Let his days be few;
let another take his office.
Let his children be orphans,
and his wife a widow,
and let his children wander aimlessly and beg,
and let them plead from their ruins.
Let \add the\add* creditor seize all that \add is\add* his,
and let strangers plunder his property.
Let there be none \add who\add* extend to him loyal love,
nor any who pities his orphans.
Let his descendants\f + \fr 109:13 \ft Or “posterity”; Hebrew is singular \f* be cut off.
Let their name be blotted out in \add the\add* next generation.
Let the iniquity of his ancestors\f + \fr 109:14 \ft Or “fathers” \f* be remembered before Yahweh,
and let the sin of his mother not be blotted out.
Let them be before Yahweh continually,
that he may cut off their\f + \fr 109:15 \ft That is, the family \f* memory from \add the\add* earth,
because he did not remember to show loyal love,
but he pursued anyone,\f + \fr 109:16 \ft Hebrew “a man” \f* poor or needy
or brokenhearted, to slay \add them\add*.
Because he loved cursing, let it come \add upon\add* him.
Because he did not delight in blessing,
let it be far from him.
Because he wore a curse as his robe,
let it enter ⸤his body⸥\f + \fr 109:18 \ft Literally “his inward part” \f* like water,
and into his bones like oil.
May it be for him like a garment \add in which\add* he wraps,
and a belt ⸤he continually wears⸥.\f + \fr 109:19 \ft Literally “continually he girds it” \f*
Let this \add be\add* the punishment for my accusers from Yahweh,
even those who speak evil against my life.
But you, O Yahweh my Lord,
deal with me for your name’s sake.
Because your loyal love \add is\add* good, deliver me,
for I \add am\add* poor and needy,
and my heart is wounded within me.
Like a lengthening shadow I am passing away;
I am shaken off like a locust.
My knees ⸤buckle⸥\f + \fr 109:24 \ft Literally “stumble” \f* from fasting,
and my body grows lean without fat.
And \add so\add* I am a disgrace to them;
\add when\add* they see me, they shake their heads.\f + \fr 109:25 \ft Hebrew “head” \f*
Help me, O Yahweh my God;
save me according to your loyal love,
that they may know that this \add is\add* your hand,
\add that\add* you, O Yahweh, you have done it.
Let them curse, but you bless.
\add When\add* they arise, let them be put to shame,
that your servant may be glad.
Let my accusers put on disgrace,
and let them cover \add themselves\add* with their shame as with a robe.
I will give thanks to Yahweh exceedingly with my mouth,
and in \add the\add* midst of many I will praise him,
for he stands at \add the\add* right \add hand\add* of \add the\add* needy,
to save \add him\add* from those judging his life.\f + \fr 109:31 \ft Or “soul” \f*
